name: Router) merge to TiDB.txt - Dump from TiDB:
description: This section explains the process of taking a data dump from a TiDB database instance for two specific databases: 'prod_pg_router' and 'pgpayments_card_live'. The data dump is required to be restored on a different instance, referred to as the 'harvester instance'. The section provides the necessary commands to perform the data dump from TiDB.
use_cases: Data migration from one TiDB instance to another
Backup and restore of TiDB databases
Replicating data across different TiDB instances

name: Router) merge to TiDB.txt - Restore the database to Harvester
description: This section provides instructions for exporting data from a TiDB database and restoring it to a Harvester database. It involves using the mysqldump utility to create SQL dump files for specific tables from two different databases (prod_pg_router and pgpayments_card_live). These dump files can then be used to restore the data to the Harvester database.
use_cases: Migrating data from TiDB to Harvester
Backing up specific tables from a database
Restoring data from SQL dump files
capabilities: Database restoration from SQL dump files

name: Router) merge to TiDB.txt - Payments Cards  to Api Cards
description: This section explains the process of migrating payment card data from an existing database to a new API database. It involves creating temporary tables, extracting card data from a JSON column, cleaning up the data, and inserting it into the new 'api.cards' table. The steps include creating a temporary table, inserting data from the existing 'payments' table while extracting JSON fields, trimming quotes from string fields, and finally inserting the cleaned data into the 'api.cards' table.
use_cases: Migrating payment card data from an existing database to a new API database
Consolidating and restructuring payment card data for better organization and accessibility
Preparing payment card data for integration with a new API or application
capabilities: Handling different data types (strings, integers, etc.)
Trimming unwanted characters from string fields
